alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 04 at 3:55AM PDT until April 05 at 10:59AM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Washington, including the following county, Mason. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rains over the south slopes of the Olympic mountains Sunday and today could push small streams and rivers in Mason county above flood stage Monday morning. The Skokomish River is forecasted to flood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
